attributes.title: Megastorm Aftermath
attributes.description_short: How can cities prepare for rising seas and raging storms?
attributes.description_long: In October 2012, Megastorm Sandy cut a path of devastation across the Caribbean and the East Coast, killing hundreds and doing tens of billions of dollars in damage. To many, it was a wake-up call. Now, one year after Sandy's deadly strike, NOVA follows up on the 2012 film "Inside the Megastorm" with a fresh investigation of the critical questions raised by this historic storm.
attributes.funder_message: Funding for NOVA is provided by David H. Koch, the Corporation for Public Broadcasting and PBS viewers. Additional funding is provided by the Millicent and Eugene Bell Foundation, Roger and Vicki Sant, the Rockefeller Foundation, the Kresge Foundation, and the Kendeda Fund.

attributes.description_short: How can cities prepare for rising seas and raging storms?
attributes.description_long: In October 2012, superstorm Sandy cut a path of devastation across the Caribbean and the East Coast, killing hundreds and doing tens of billions of dollars in damage. Now, one year after Sandy’s deadly strike, NOVA follows up on its 2012 film “Inside the Megastorm” with a fresh investigation of the critical questions raised by this historic storm.

attributes.title: Floating Buildings
attributes.description_short: Engineers in the Netherlands propose building homes that float on water.
attributes.description_long: For generations, the Dutch have regarded the water surrounding them as an enemy, building dams and dykes to fend it off. But with climate scientists predicting sea level rises and increased flooding, some engineers are taking a different approach. Their solution? Floating buildings, which work with the water rather than against it, creating a real-life water world.

attributes.description_long: Could shellfish beds protect New York from flooding?

attributes.title: Storm Surges and New York City
Reimagining New York
attributes.description_short: A risk management expert says that we must look to New York’s future to prevent flooding.
attributes.description_long: Disaster risk management expert Klaus Jacob speaks candidly about the effects of climate change and sea level rise on New York City. He says we need to think ahead to what New York will look like 400 years from now in order to plan effectively.

attributes.title: Repairing the Beach After Sandy
attributes.description_short: To rebuild the coastline, engineers are pumping sand onto New York’s Coney Island beach.
attributes.description_long: To rebuild the coastline, engineers are pumping sand onto New York’s Coney Island beach.

attributes.title: Judo with Nature
attributes.description_short: Planting trees in front of dikes is one way to keep large waves from flooding the shore.
attributes.description_long: Planting trees in front of dikes is one way to keep large waves from flooding the shore.
